name: Pousada de Obidos Historic Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at the Pousada on the 16th December 2007and the best word to describe the experience was ... "disappointing".
reviews.title: Disappointing

reviews.text: The rooms was very small, so small that I had trouble arranging space to open my suitcase. The bathroom was hardly big enough for two people.The Pousada only has one sitting room, a bar and a restaurant, no games room, no swimming pool or other facilities.
reviews.title: Unique Castel Experience

reviews.text: The only thing good about it was the friendly staff, and a great view from the room overlooking the town walls.
reviews.title: Biggest disappointment of our Portugal trip
Worth the splurge
reviews.text: Too expensive for the service they provide. Will not return again.

We enjoyed our one night here - the town itself is very touristy, so if not for our unique experience at the pousada, we would not have really enjoyed ourselves. Our room was smallish but comfortable and it's hard to beat the view out over the castle walls. We found the service to be good, the room very clean.
reviews.title: lovely historic hotel
Pousada do Castelo is the TOPS!
reviews.text: My husband and I also stayed here on our honeymoon and what an experience! We paid a little extra to stay in the one and only tower room but it was well worth it. The bedroom is up a winding narrow staircase and the bed is covered by a canopy. From our doorstep we had a picturesque view of Obidos. We truly felt like royalty. Recommend at least one night here. One to two days tops is enough time in Obidos.

we stayed in this old castle for one night, and it was nice. the room was small, but had a queen bed with a down comforter. there was a bar in a cosy alcove, and the staff were good. However, this town is nothing more than tourist trap, with all the shops selling the same tired trinkets. I think you would do better to stay at a pousada in a more interesting town. It took my husband and I an hour to see the town and walk on the medevil wall, then we were wondering what to do with ourselves. Definetly arrive by car in you can, as the walk in is very long and uphill. If you want to stay here, come late in afternoon, see the town, spend the night , then get up and move on to more interesting places.....
reviews.title: lovely castle, boring town
An experience unlike any other.
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed here for one night on our honeymoon and it's incredible and unique. The hotel is part of the castle walls and we stayed in the tower room of the city walls with views of the entire town.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent the night at this pousada while driving from Porto to Lisbon. We chose it because we thought it would be different, and it certainly was. Like some other have already said, it's hard to find the actual entrance. We relied on our GPS, but that only took us so far. We were unclear what was considered roads for vehicular traffic, because they all seems so narrow. We finally put the car in a lot behind the pousada. I walked up with one of our smaller bags, and it was still difficult (uphill, steps, cobblestone). The front desk immediately sent someone down to the parking lot to direct my husband to the parking right in front of the pousada, and also to help with the bags.
reviews.title: My first medieval castle stay...and it was worth it!

reviews.text: They showed us to our room, 202, which was quite roomy and comfortable.
reviews.title: Awesome hotel - if you can find it ...

reviews.text: The town is very quaint. You could walk around the fortress walls, where there are great views. We ate at O Lidador for dinner, which was very good and reasonable. Teh Pousada restaurant seemed to be much more expensive, but there are several options along the main street in town.
reviews.title: Neat But Not Cheap

reviews.text: We stayed at this Pousada for one night during our two-week vacation in Portugal during the summer, simply because we wanted our daughters to be able to say they slept in a castle for a night. :) Plus, I had always wanted to visit this town. So we booked a one-night stay. My husband called the hotel directly (he is Portuguese) and said they were extremely nice and polite.
reviews.title: WHOAAA!

reviews.text: It is hard to find your way to this hotel! Maybe we missed a sign or something, but you have to drive up a long, winding and steep road that supposedly is limited to only locals. We didn't know if we counted as locals, but took it all the same, with tour groups and pedestrians staring at us, so we thought we were doing something wrong! And then you finally enter the castle walls, arrive at the top of the hill, go under this narrow archway, and the signs for the Pousadas are right there.
reviews.title: Skip dinner and you should enjoy the castle

description: The Pousada do Castelo was created in 1951 in Óbidos Castle — one of the 7 Wonders of Portugal, thus becoming the first to be adapted, restored and converted into one of the most beautiful Historic Pousadas in the country.The building, erected by D. João de Noronha at the beginning of the 16th century, retains its major details: the Manueline-style windows, the Portal de Verga Golpeada adorned with twisted tree trunks topped by the shield and coat of arms of the Noronhas. But above all, tales and stories remain, such as the story of its rebuilding after the 1755 earthquake. Stories that make us wish to discover more about this medieval scenario, ideal for getting away from stress. Stories which after your visit will become your own. Relax and enjoy a visit which you will not easily forget.In the Restaurant of the Pousada do Castelo, you will embark in a fantastic journey through the richness of the best regional cuisine of the west, with an endless variety of flavours full of traditions. Known for its superior quality, the venue will offer you a true pleasure in each meal thanks to the local products of each season,carefully prepared by our Chef. All of this without forgetting its historic and highly refined setting, with a truly unique environment. Certainly, a meal that will leave you speechless.
